are obvious just having a laugh
Why do the troll boys have to take everything so damn seriously?
summary: Captain Marvel Fan: Carol could totally lift Thor's hammer, haha! Trollboy: OMG! NO SHE CAN’T! STOP MAKING HER MORE THAN SHE IS!...
body:
Captain Marvel Fan: Carol could totally lift Thor’s hammer, haha!

Trollboy: OMG! NO SHE CAN’T! STOP MAKING HER MORE THAN SHE IS! SHE’S SO MARY SUE! SO OP! IF STEVE COULDN’T LIFT IT THEN THERE’S NO WAY SHE CAN! NO FREAKING WAY! JUST STFU! SHE CAN NOT LIFT THOR’S HAMMER FOR F*CKS SAKE! *continues to rant for far longer than a normal person should*

Captain Marvel Fan: … Dude… Chill. It was just a joke. Take a breath.

summary: The scene is really heartbreaking, it looks like Steve is tired and yet he is trying to convince himself to do it. Just one last...
body:
The scene is really heartbreaking, it looks like Steve is tired and yet he is trying to convince himself to do it. Just one last time. Not because he wants to, but he has to. To Avenge his friends and the people he loved.

Just one last time.

reblog.comment:
The scene is really heartbreaking, it looks like Steve is tired and yet he is trying to convince himself to do it. Just one last time. Not because he wants to, but he has to. To Avenge his friends and the people he loved.

Just one last time.

summary: I don’t know how do I feel about Death Battle jumping on the bandwagon and making Billy fight Carol right as their movies are...
caption:
I don’t know how do I feel about Death Battle jumping on the bandwagon and making Billy fight Carol right as their movies are being pitted against each other so much even Zachary Levi said he is sick of it…but this exchange is gold

Boomstick: Wait, wait, wait. That’s it? No freaky alien genes, no parents getting gunned down in an alley? He just…popped on a train and showed up to meet some old dude?! Where’s the tragedy, where’s the drama?

Whiz: Boomstick, he’s an orphan.

- Admin

summary: Butthurt Troll: Well I’VE seen the film and so I can say Carol is bland and boring and the film sucks! So let’s make something...
body:
Butthurt Troll: Well I’VE seen the film and so I can say Carol is bland and boring and the film sucks!

So let’s make something clear.

If you didn’t like the film, that’s cool. If you found the film kind of boring because the story itself is pretty standard and it doesn’t really bring much new story-wise to the MCU, then that’s fine. If you’re just not a general fan of Carol or Captain Marvel as characters because they rub you the wrong way and you just don’t like how they behave in certain scenes or what they do in the film and comic, that is one hundred percent okay.

But you cannot tell me that

Carol

Danvers

was

bland

or

boring.

She had just as much fun character in her as Thor (who had his fair share of blank expression when being serious) or Tony (who was just as snarky funny as Carol was cheeky funny) or Steve (who was a strict soldier on missions as much as Carol) or any of the other characters in the MCU. More even, if you ask me. She was such a delight on screen. A character who could be tough but also who laughed, teased others, was cheeky with friends and enemies alike and just overall old fashion comic book joy to watch.

If you actually did see the film and still claim that she was “bland” or “boring”, then you clearly went into the film DETERMINED to hate it. And I just don’t have the time for that kind of stupid bias.

Captain Marvel is a good film. Maybe not the best but certainly nowhere near the worst.

Get over it.

summary: You are Carol Danvers. You are the woman on that black box risking her life to do the right thing. My best friend, who supported...
body: You are Carol Danvers. You are the woman on that black box risking her life to do the right thing. My best friend, who supported me as a mother, and a pilot when no one else did. You’re smart, and funny, and a huge pain in the ass. And you are the most powerful person I know.

reblog.comment: You are Carol Danvers. You are the woman on that black box risking her life to do the right thing. My best friend, who supported me as a mother, and a pilot when no one else did. You’re smart, and funny, and a huge pain in the ass. And you are the most powerful person I know.

trail.content_raw: You are Carol Danvers. You are the woman on that black box risking her life to do the right thing. My best friend, who supported me as a mother, and a pilot when no one else did. You’re smart, and funny, and a huge pain in the ass. And you are the most powerful person I know.
